thread.section_title: South Florida Sports News - Sun Sentinel
thread.title: Michael Irvin to be honored at St. Thomas Aquinas
thread.title_full: Michael Irvin to be honored at St. Thomas Aquinas - Sun Sentinel

author: sun-sentinel.com
title: Michael Irvin to be honored at St. Thomas Aquinas
text:
The Pro Football Hall of Fame and Ford will pay tribute to Gold Jacket Michael Irvin at his high school alma mater, St. Thomas Aquinas High on Friday, October 30. Irvin will be honored as part of the “Hometown Hall of Famer: program.
Hometown Hall of Famer is a national program that honors the hometown roots of the greatest heroes of the game with special ceremonies and plaque dedication events in local communities.
Irvin, a South Florida native and graduate of St. Thomas Aquinas, will be on hand at his former high school for a special event and plaque presentation. Following the presentation, the plaque will be on permanent display at the school.
Irvin was drafted out of the University of Miami by the Dallas Cowboys in the first round of the 1988 NFL Draft. In 12 seasons, the talented receiver hauled in 750 career catches for 11,904 yards and 65 TDs.
He recorded 1,000-yard seasons every year but one during an eight-year span from 1991-98. He was selected to five straight Pro Bowls and named to the NFL’s All-Decade Team of the 1990s.
Irvin, who today works as an analyst for NFL Network, was enshrined into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2007.
 Michael Irvin NFL Dallas Cowboys
